alert.note: Alert for Gunnison (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Air Quality Alert issued August 07 at 4:11PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...AIR QUALITY HEALTH ADVISORY FOR WILDFIRE SMOKE FROM 900 AM MONDAY UNTIL 900 AM TUESDAY... The Colorado Department of Public Health and Environment has issued the following... WHAT...Air Quality Health Advisory for Wildfire Smoke. WHERE...central Gunnison County. Locations include, but are not limited to Gunnison. WHEN...900 AM Monday August 07 to 900 AM Tuesday August 08 IMPACTS...The Lowline wildfire is located in central Gunnison County approximately 10 miles southwest of Crested Butte and 14 miles northwest of Gunnison. Moderate to heavy smoke is possible early Monday morning from the fire, southward along County Road 730 to Gunnison. Smoke in these areas should decrease by late Monday morning as atmospheric mixing increases. By Monday afternoon, smoke will likely be transported east of the fire. Most of that smoke will remain aloft and well above ground level, however brief periods of moderate to heavy smoke will be possible across eastern Gunnison County, including Crested Butte. Late Monday night and into Tuesday morning, smoke could again get heavy as it drains eastward towards County Road 730 and southward into Gunnison. HEALTH INFORMATION...Public Health Recommendations: If smoke is thick or becomes thick in your neighborhood you may want to remain indoors. This is especially true for those with heart disease, respiratory illnesses, the very young, and the elderly. Consider limiting outdoor activity when moderate to heavy smoke is present. Consider relocating temporarily if smoke is present indoors and is making you ill. If visibility is less than 5 miles in smoke in your neighborhood, smoke has reached levels that are unhealthy.
